PageTitle: multicast mvpn (VPN instance IPv4 address family view)
FuncDef:
The multicast mvpn command sets an MVPN ID for a VPN instance in the IPv4 address family view, that is, an IP address for the originator PE in an MPVN instance.
The undo multicast mvpn command deletes the MVPN ID of a VPN instance.
By default, no MVPN ID is set for a VPN instance.
ParentView: VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Sets an MVPN ID for a VPN instance.
The value is an IPv4 address, in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set an MVPN ID for a VPN instance in the IPv4 address family view, that is, an IP address for the originator PE in an MPVN instance, run the multicast mvpn command. After the command is run, the originator PE uses the specified MVPN ID, not the global MVPN ID, to apply for tunnel resources.
The specified MVPN ID works with static routes to generate P2MP mLDP LSPs, implementing NG MVPN 1+1 node protection.
Precautions
If the multicast mvpn command is not run in the VPN instance IPv4 address family view, the MVPN ID specified in the system view is used. If MVPN IDs are specified in both the system view and VPN instance IPv4 address family view, only the MVPN ID specified in the VPN instance IPv4 address family view takes effect.
